meanings.definition: To administer the Eucharist to (a person).
meanings.sent1: The priest will housel the parishioners during the Sunday service.
meanings.sent2: It is a tradition for the priest to housel the congregation during communion.
meanings.sent3: The priest accidentally tried to housel the wrong person, causing a moment of confusion.
meanings.sent4: The act of houseling brings a sense of peace and unity to the community.
meanings.sent5: The gentle way the priest housels each person shows care and respect.

meanings.sent1: The housel is an important part of the church service.
meanings.sent2: Parishioners receive the housel during communion.
meanings.sent3: The golden chalice used for the housel sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The housel symbolizes the spiritual nourishment of the faithful.
meanings.sent5: The housel is a sacred moment of communion with God.
